question: Looking at this choropleth map, which statement below is the most accurate?

options.A: States B, H, D have similar values.
options.B: The value difference between State B and State C is large.
options.C: The value gap between State B and State J might less that between State B and State E.
options.D: The value differences are impossible to determine from this visualization.

explanation: Category E (45) and Category B (55) have a 10-point difference, while Category B (55) and Category J (60) have a 5-point difference. However, the categorical color encoding groups B and E into the same color bin (40+ range), making their difference appear similar, while J and B appear more different due to different color bins.
